course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Personality Psychology
course.description: This course surveys the principal approaches to studying personality and examines relevant modern research.
course.prerequisites: SOSC 1960 OR SOSC 1980

reviews.author: Brian
reviews.comment_content:
The course will teach you different approaches for understanding personality. You will spend more time learning about the psychoanalytic (extremely odd but interesting, especially if you like penises) and trait approaches, which will be tested on the midterm. The behavioral, humanistic, cognitive, and biological approaches are tested on the final.

The content is great in the sense that it provides insight into and allows you to think about your own and others' personalities through many different perspectives, including but not limited to childhood, behavior, culture, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
If Michelle tells the students about the heavy workload in the first lecture and suggests the students to drop, don't. I think she just wants a smaller class.

Michelle was able to make the class interesting and engages with all her students, especially ones that show up late (for bants). Her teaching style makes it very easy to follow. She also gives out free lecture notes during class.
reviews.comment_grading: Excellent. Check the other person's post for the grading scheme.
reviews.comment_workload:
Make sure you read the book. But try not to leave all the readings until the last 9 hours before the exam like me and you'll be fine. The readings are indulging but account for half the textbook for the midterm and final respectively and do take some time to fully digest.

Attending the morning lectures seemed hard at first, but the good teaching made up for the early lectures.

Oh and there's a case study. It was relatively easy due to the fact that it was due after the final and mainly uses concepts from one approach that was tested on the midterm, so you know what's going on when analyzing the case. The hardest part is making it concise enough to fit into 10 pages.

reviews.author: Tuna
reviews.comment_content:
Learning personality through the six approaches.
Psychoanalytic, trait, behavioural, cognitive, biological and humanistic approaches are covered, she has a final wrap up for the integration (though it was a really quick and short one)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Michelle is a funny instructor, although she set guidelines in the first class and then 1/3 of the class dropped out (perhaps people are scared by her). She treated the class as a 'mom style'. She cared about each student. Her funny and interactive way of teaching made the 3 hour class cool. She included many experience in the class so the pace of teaching is quite slow. And in the last week of course, she lagged behind the syllabus and became much more efficient in terms in teaching which seems better to us.

She included a personality test at the beginning of the course so we can understand ourself better.
reviews.comment_grading:
20% Class participation
20% Midterm
40% Final
20% Group case write up (not more than 10 pages including cover page and reference)

She only disclosed the mid term and final score
I got above mean for ~0.5 sd for both and result in a A range.
Quite good
Since we are taking it in the winter semester, she claimed that she distribute the grade based on her own teaching experience. But my group mate all get a higher grade than expected.
Also Michelle said that our mean for midterm is higher than those classes she taught before so she adjust the grade accordingly i guess.
reviews.comment_workload:
you have to submit a query sheet after each topic, to ask questions on that topic that she did not cover from the lecture. The scores are based on the quantity and quality of questions you asked.

5-7 people in a group for the case write up. It was only 10 pages so each people only need to write about 2 pages. It seems quite manageable to our group. But one of the group only consist 3 people and I am not sure about their workload. It was not that hard to write it as long as you have good group mates.

Midterm and final were the most challenging part of the course, you have to study both course material and read the textbook. She covered quite a lot from the textbook where some parts are never mentioned in her lecture. Midterm are all MC questions and Final are both MC and essay.

reviews.author: Weird Guy
reviews.comment_content: The content covered was very interesting. It covers personality as defined by the trait, humanistic, cognitive, psychoanalytic, behavioural and biological approaches. Relevant research was discussed.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Excellent. Michelle is one of the best professors I have had in UST. There were active class discussions. She asked us to submit a query sheet after every chapter. This helped us understand each topic better. One need not worry about lecture slides as she prints it out for the students.
Even though the class is three hours, one would not feel bored. If you're an international student, be prepared for Michelle to ask you many questions during the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is alright. It is based on the midterm, final, group project, and class participation.
For the midterm and final exams, it is recommended to read the textbook as a lot of questions come from the book.
The group project is on a case study. One would have to read the case study and give a 10-page report (only one per group, not individually) on the personality based on the trait approach.
Class participation was based on the quality of questions asked on the query sheet.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is a little high.The exams required reading a lot of the chapters from the textbook.
The workload on the group project depends on the type of group members.
Class participation can help one get a better grade. So, do remember to go to class as Michelle does not allow the submission of the query sheets on any day except the time when she completes the chapter.

reviews.author: penguin3220
reviews.comment_content: Look at others, nothing add on:)
reviews.comment_teaching: Although she is not young, Michelle is super chill and I had fun in her lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
Individual Assignments 30% (10% per each assignment)
my score: 28/30

Group Case Analysis 25%
she did not give us the exact mark, just a grade (A range for me)

Test 1 15% (ALL MC)
50/60 (above mean ard 1 SD)

Test 2 30%(in essay format)
18/30 (below mean <0.5 SD)

Overall: A-
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy comparing to other courses. You can see from the assessment, there's only 3 assignments, a small group case, and two tests.

reviews.comment_content:
The content is pretty interesting and useful.

CH1: The Psychoanalytic Approach

CH2: The Psychoanalytic Approach

CH3: The Trait Approach

CH4: The Behavioral Approach

CH5: The Humanistic Approach

CH6: The Cognitive Approach

CH7: The Biological Approach

CH8: Overlap & Integration
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof's teaching is good, she explained the concepts and give examples very clearly. If you find it difficult to understand the concepts, you can learn them on YouTube.

However, she seems to be very strict on the assignment and tests, so must be well prepared.
reviews.comment_grading:
COURSE ASSESSMENT

Individual Assignments  30%
Group Case Analysis  25%
Test 1  15%
Test 2  30%


We have a total of 4 individual assignments, which are very important, she will only count the best 3 assignments. However, the last assignment is difficult compared with the 1-3 assignment, so must pay attention to it all.

Test 1 and Test 2 (midterm & exam)
are hard, you must buy the text-book!!

I did great on the assignment and group project but did very poorly on both tests.
reviews.comment_workload:
I think the workload is not that heavy, 4 assignments(case study) and one group project are interesting, help you to understand the concepts more.

But you have to prepare a lot so that get a good grade on tests.

reviews.author: Sally han
reviews.comment_content:
1. introduction
2. the psychoanalytic approach
3. trait approach
4. behavioral approach
5. humanistic approach
6. cognitive approach
6. biological approach

If you have taken an Ap psych or IB psych course the content is relatively easy.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor seems very smart and eager. Easy to follow and she gives you very good examples and even chocolates.
But she seems very strict with her rules so unless you do everything you are told and seem active in class she will like you.
reviews.comment_grading:
class participation 20%
group case 20%
mid term 20%
Final 40%

I don't get how she counts the class participation except you get this query sheet after each chapter is finished. group case is easy to get marks but I got such a low grade C+ when I had similar scores to my friend who got a B. So I think something depended on the participation mark.
reviews.comment_workload:
there is a lot of reading per chapter and it is important to attend every class. group case doesn't require much work because you have a lot of people doing it together.
The hardest part for me was the 3 hour class 9am on friday.
